page.title: 09Language
page.content: The older inhabitants refered to the village as "Stan". In this remote and thinly populated village the natives speak quite good English without many of the "Oldy Worldy" words one hears in near by villages. {Grammer}has significantly improved due to education and an influx of people from all over the country. The {Accents}have a definate welsh lilt mixed with the Herefordshire open vowles.We believe that we have an accent of our own which is intresting and pleasent to ear. {Dialect}is less pronounced than in the past.Words are used with differant meanings than the norm,e.g.: {Starved= meaning cold { Nesh= feels the cold { In Her Doubles=Old and Bent { A strat =A mean man
